content:
Hello,

The '[ ]' allow to have eq.refl : ∀ (a : ?M_1), eq a a instead of eq.refl : eq ?M_2 ?M_2

What exactly do they do?
For example here it doesn't change anything.

inductive my_nat
| zero : my_nat
| succ []: my_nat → my_nat

There are also variants with '{ }', in the above example it seems to do the same thing.
